evidence.text:
Person A: So what are you going to wear?
Person B: Who’s Ed?
Person B: You can’t come if you don’t have hiking shoes. We’ll leave you behind.

Person A: Can Mary spend the night?
Person B: No!
Person A: Why?
Person B: I thought you were in love with- Mary?

Person A: What do you mean?
Person A: I am in love with Mary -I’m just having fun with Ophelia.
Person B: Yes. Are you okay? How is Mary?

Person A: Mom, you need to come home. Dad needs you. He refuses to leave the theatre, he doesn't eat, he is reading the bible.
Person A: He’ll forgive you.
Person B: What did he tell you?
Person A: Nothing.
Person A: Mary forgave me.
Person A: It’s ok, mom. He’ll forgive you.
Person B: It’s my fault. I told you I was someone else, and then I started to get angry that you didn’t understand who I really was. That’s my- problem, not yours. I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.
